description: This moves all of the SPH frontends into their own directories.  I've also gone through all files and cleaned out unused imports.  This may fail a number of tests as I removed all "import *"s.
title: Moving SPH frontends into their own directories.

pullrequest.title: Moving SPH frontends into their own directories.

content.raw: Thanks for taking this on Britton!
content.html: Thanks for taking this on Britton!

pullrequest.title: Moving SPH frontends into their own directories.

content.raw: Glad to!  I love organizing things.
content.html: Glad to! I love organizing things.

pullrequest.title: Moving SPH frontends into their own directories.

content.raw: Something went wrong, you should checkout http://tests.yt-project.org/job/py2.7-yt-3.0_testing/1540/
content.html: Something went wrong, you should checkout http://tests.yt-project.org/job/py2.7-yt-3.0_testing/1540/

pullrequest.title: Moving SPH frontends into their own directories.

content.raw: I just updated this with a merge of PR #1277 but it's not clear to me how to apply what @ngoldbaum did to these nested frontends.  Any advice is welcome.
content.html: I just updated this with a merge of PR #1277 but it's not clear to me how to apply what Nathan Goldbaum did to these nested frontends. Any advice is welcome.

pullrequest.title: Moving SPH frontends into their own directories.

content.raw: I think you'll either need to sph folder so everything lives in the frontends folder or if you want to keep the sph subfolder, add some extra magic to the import logic in `sph/api.py` to handle the subfolder.
content.html: I think you'll either need to sph folder so everything lives in the frontends folder or if you want to keep the sph subfolder, add some extra magic to the import logic in sph/api.py to handle the subfolder.

pullrequest.title: Moving SPH frontends into their own directories.

content.raw: I'm ok with moving the individual frontends out of the sph folder and into ``yt/frontends``.  We'll still need to keep an ``sph`` directory as it contains some things that the others import, but that would probably be ok.  Are there any objections to this?
content.html: I'm ok with moving the individual frontends out of the sph folder and into yt/frontends. We'll still need to keep an sph directory as it contains some things that the others import, but that would probably be ok. Are there any objections to this?

pullrequest.title: Moving SPH frontends into their own directories.

content.raw: I've thought about this and I think it makes sense to not nest the frontends.  I'm going to do move them.
content.html: I've thought about this and I think it makes sense to not nest the frontends. I'm going to do move them.
